I think the two highlights of Battlefield Earth were the special effects and John Travolta's portrayal of Terl.  I had hoped the film would have followed the book more closely but I realize that would have been impossible (due to the size of the book).  I'm sure when Part 2 is released it will be better than the first film and (hopefully) will follow the book more closely.

reviews.review_title: John Travolta aka Alien Snydley Whiplash
reviews.content: I have seen this movie twice thanks to HBO.  Never would have been enough. No, strike that.  It's a must see for all aspiring actors and directors.  If you can learn how to make a good monster movie by watching TOHO International do Godzilla, then you can make a good aliens-take-over-and-oppressed-humans-fight-back movie by watching Battlefield Earth.  Independence Day...this is not.Travolta was lost in this part. Or more accurately, he was in his own movie despite the other actors on the set.  The result was an over-the-top comic melodrama, but only on his part.  There he is, half dog half ape. The evil Alien Capitalist Intergallactic Hanseatic League Aspiring Home Office Weasle.  He would be doing Snydley Whiplash, laughter and all, in the middle of a scene with the other actors trying their hardest to 'move the scene along'.  You can just hear the sighs as the board goes 'clack' and someone yells Cut!  I think they were actually expecting some set-hand to run out and slice Travolta's throat for destroying what could have been a decent film.I'm buying this one and placing right up there with Mothra.  I won't even go into the insane technical mistakes other than if you believe a thousand year old Marine jet can fly with no maintenance, and be flown by a savage trained in a simulator, then this is your film.   Or if you can believe an alien race can conquer planets and not discover dentistry...then yes sir, buy this one.  Too much to ponder.

reviews.review_title: This movie was a disappointment, but I've seen far worse than this.
reviews.content: I cant believe this movie is in the top 100 all time worst. I can easily think of 100 movies worse than this one. Either I watch to many bad films and people who voted have done the opposite, or I have bad taste. However, what I was *#%@ that I payed to see this in the theater, but I found this movie in the blockbuster bargain bin for $3 and bought it, so I must have felt it was worth watching again, still haven't played it. You can't watch a movie like this and take it seriously, or you'll find you'll spend the entire movie tearing it apart. Yah this one is cheesy, but hey, at least it had a really cool ending!

Battlefield Earth is awesome and gets better with each viewing.  John Travolta and Barry were exceptional, the special effects were outstanding and the directing may have created a new art form!  And, I guess that that says it all but I still have to get in four lines to get posted.

This is the only movie I have ever seen not to have a redeeming quality. The acting (even by the esteemed Travola and Whitaker) is laughable, the script only accentuates the overacting with stupid lines such as "we need more leverage." The direction is possibly the worst part of the movie, as the whole thing is shot at a very unnatural angle, causing everyone to tilt their just enough to get a migraine headache. And, of course, the legendary plot holes: learning fly a fighter jet in 2 minutes? I think not. Translating between English and English? I think not. Using shoestrings for oxygen? I think not. 1000 year old jets working? I think not. Enjoying this movie? I think not.

An absolute waste of my money, and I don't suggest you waste yours.  There was only one thing interesting in this movie, John Trovolta trying to be a villain.  I got the impression that if I had read the book I might have cared what was happening to the characters.  The movie itself was not enough to get me involved.  I was clueless about their motivations.  They mostly seemed senselessly, and melodramatically, villainous or heroic.

reviews.review_title: So bad I feel sorry for it
reviews.content: I'll give it credit for having good graphics, but that does not make up for the bad writing and acting.  I have respect for John Travolta, but now I dont know what to think.  I dont think it deserves to be in the bottom 100, but still is the worst movie i've seen in a long time.

I honestly can't believe that this movie was meant to be taken seriously. I mean, it starts out fine, the human race has been almost completely wiped out, and are now forced into small tribes. I'll be honest, but human actors aren't actually that bad, the main character Johnny is actually pretty good, but then the aliens appear. They look like tall humans with dreadlocks, and light blue skin, it doesn't look very convincing. And the voices are so bad, I mean, I have nothing against John Travolta, but he sounds like he's trying to act as feminine as possible. However when they talk in their native language, they actually sound pretty cool, why didn't they just keep that.The effects aren't the worst, I mean for the budget they didn't look horrid. And I just can't believe what these aliens are talking about, promotions, affairs, work, plus they drink, have tabs, and basically talk like humans. Maybe this was originally in the book, and maybe the book was good, but it just didn't translate well to screen, like at all.

This is one of the worse movies I have ever (tried to) watch. It was painful. It isn't even worth watching as a diversion. Even JT couldn't save this movie. I am not sure what the message is that L. Ron Hubbard was trying to relay to us with this movie, but whatever the message was - it was lost.

I rented this expecting it to be horrible, good for a laugh. I am glad to say I was wrong. There are many awful reviews for this movie, but let me tell you, this movie is a work of art!Travolta is perfectly cast as the evil alien who has enslaved man-kind, and we cheer along with man kind as they start a revolt. There is great indepth charactirisation, and each character you can relate to, in some way.
The movie has a fun plot, and while it will not win any points for originality, it never ceases to be enjoyable.This movie both entertains and teaches, which is not an easy task. This movie is thought provoking, and I was pleasantly surprised! Forget the awful reviews, this is a great film!I hear they are now making a TV series of this, and if it is as good as this movie, I will be an avid watcher!

reviews.review_title: Bad, but fascinatingly and watchably bad.
reviews.content: Years after the fall of human civilization, Human Johnnie (Barry Pepper) finds himself an unlikely hero in an uprising against the alien Psychlo race as he leads mankind to take back the planet from Terl (John Travolta).Released in 2000 to abysmal reviews and worse box office, Battlefield Earth was a longtime passion project from Star/Producer John Travolta. The movie is based on the first half of the L. Ron Hubbard science fiction novel of the same name, and was intended to be a massive blockbuster franchise complete with a toyline, sequel and a thirteen episode animated series (the latter two were cancelled). Battlefield Earth ended up being not just a massive embarrassment, but a monumental example in how not to make a blockbuster sci-fi action film.The movie's cast for all the film's faults aren't boring (albeit not exactly good). Barry Pepper brings enthusiasm to the rather flat role of hero Johnnie Goodboy Taylor, and noted character actors Forest Whitaker and Kim Coates are as reliable and effortlessly watchable as ever, but John Travolta as Terl steals the show with an overly hammy performance wherein he over enunciates every other word resulting in a hypnotically strange delivery that can't help but draw you in. The movie is worth watching just for Travolta's weird performance alone.Every other technical aspect and story telling aspect is absolutely awful. The cinematography with its dark murky colors that range from washed out grays to oppressive dark violets and navy blues results in a dreary looking film that is just hideous to look at. The framing of shots with 95% of camera angles being dutch angles feel disorienting and like the movie might fall off the screen. The movie also overuses curtain wipes to the point where most if not all scene transitions are done with them. Director Roger Christian was nominated for an Oscar for Art Director on Alien and WON an Oscar for set decoration on Star Wars: A New Hope so the fact he made a big budget sci-fi film this ugly and this incompetent is simply baffling. The story is also filled with massive holes and contrivances but strangely enough the movie has some dumbness dialed down from the book such as a sequence where Terl mistook Johnnie riding a horse for ONE whole creature as opposed to two separate creatures. Individual story elements were improved upon from the book, but it was essentially putting band-aids on bullet holes as the overall inanity of the source novel was very much kept in tact.Battlefield Earth is an awful movie, but I can't say you shouldn't see it. I myself have seen it five times (yes seriously) and while no one can say its a good movie or even passes the test of basic competence, it's a mesmerizing experience wherein every aspect is done counter to not only basic film-making but also basic common sense. This is a bad movie, but a quotable, memorable, and intriguingly bad movie.

I'm still shaking my head.  What were these people thinking?  This has got to go down as THE worst movie ever made.  And I only watched the first 15 minutes!  It was too painful watching John Travolta (and the other actors) deliver those horrible lines.  Please, do yourself a big favor and avoid this movie at all costs!!  I'm making this comment as a public service with the hope of sparing others from this atrocity.

reviews.content: Based Upon a Novel Series Called "Battlefield Earth" By L. Ron Hubbard Where in The Year Of 3000 Where Men And Women Became instinct And Been Completely Wiped Out On The Face Of The World And Where Creature Like Human Aliens Who Hunt Man Animals And Put Them in Cages And Putting Them into Hard Working Labors Now Only a Man Animal Manges To Round Up Some Other Man Animals To Take Back And Fight These Savagely Creature Alien Humans. in a Completely Different Kind Of Role John Travolta in a Over The Top Performance Plays Terl The Main Bad Guy Villian Who i Have To Say i Really Liked The Make Up Effects That They Put On Him While Barry Pepper Plays The Man Animal Rebel Hero Named Johnnie Goodboy Who's Trying To Save The Human Race And Forest Whitaker Plays Ker Terl's Assistant. Battlefield Earth Co Stars Kim Coates, Richard Tyson And Kelly Preston Who's The Real Life Wife To John Travolta Who Her And Travolta Characters Have a One Moment Scene Together. Like i Said Before Battlefield Earth is Alright Movie is Kinda Like Playing a Viedo Game Or Computer Game And Of Course There's The Not So Good CGI Visual And Special Effects Ahead Of it's Time Which To Me it Didn't Look Bad i Mean it's Okay Special And Visual Effects.

I find this film entertaining, sure there's stuff wrong but no more than most films. Quite fed up with films that have to explain everything, this film you have to fill the gaps and watch carefully.
Love the weapons, they can knock someone down as well as kill, if you think of it this way, the aliens may have had a tech that allowed them to travel in space, maybe shared with a neighbouring planet. The mind machine hints to that, they can't learn things well so they use this.
So here you have these dumb aliens striping planets of gold, all makes sense to me.
A few things wrong, like the planes that are 1000 years old but work. Film needs to be 4h long to explain how they spent a year fixing up the planes, but the milenials can't sit and watch a film for that long so they skip a whole chunk out of the potential story line.
I feel sorry for the people whos' reviews that slate things that only need imagination to get. The nuclear thing is good too, imagine a race that did not discover this, its easy to see how if they were given tech that allowed them to travel to other planets, advantage humans.
Original story, crappy mine, small minded profiteers underestimating what appears to be dumb animals. Love the film, watched it many times. Just watch it and try hard to imagine what could be.Just wish, like every other film no matter how good, a girl that lives off the land in squaller has perfect trimmed eyebrows, lovely skin and luscious hair... All wrong and it's the first thing I see in all movies.

There is one reason people should see this movie - to laugh at it.  This is one of the best movies to MST3K ever made.  The characters are idiotic, the dialogue rediculously over the top, and Travolta trundling around on stilts is too funny for words.  It may be wretched to watch sober and alone, but get some friends and some beers, and it could be the most fun you spend in front of your TV.

I have of course read all of the bad reviews on the site but I think you have dealt with this movie far too harshly.Sure its a bit like independence day, but it features good innovation(e.g.in getting the gold), some humour and enough action and special effects to lift the film.ENDING SPOILER(vagueish) The ending is how I like it to be, the good wins over the evil. But how the good does so you will have to watch the film.Since i was a fan of ID4, i enjoyed this film. Some people found the performance of John Travolta to be one of the worst in film history. However I went in with an open mind and just laughed it off, and enjoyed some of the REALLY bad acting. It turned out to be a good movie in the end. Sometimes you just have to do that.

reviews.review_title: All quiet on the protest front
reviews.content:
If there's one thing that makes me mad it's child actors, with their stupid squeaky voices and annoying fresh faces. Ooh! Butter would melt would it?But the one thing that makes me almost as angry is when aliens try and invade our planet. Well, I say our planet, but it's mostly America, and normally New York for some reason. But whatever the alien's country of choice, I get pretty riled! Personally, if I were an alien I'd invade Wales.
In this film it turns out that aliens have enslaved the whole world. In fact these aliens are like intergalactic globalisationalists who use the people of our defeated planet to mine precious minerals, much like evil capitalists do at this very moment with the third world! All these aliens care about is profit, and they're not afraid to admit it!But guess what? Those anti globalisation protesters are nowhere to be seen? Do they wave placards at the aliens, form sit-ins or deface statues of Winston Churchill? No they don't. Where are they when we really need them? The cowardly soap dodgers are probably working in an intergalactic chain of McDonalds and wearing clothes from Gap! Shame on them!Well it's all left up to this guy called Jonnie to do something about it. Does he stage a demonstration? He certainly doesn't, he uses good old-fashioned violence to prove his point, and give the aliens a right royal kicking! He enlists the help of people who look like they support Spurs to help fight back against the aliens by piloting some Harrier Jump-Jets that he finds. Thankfully, as in Independence Day' aliens have yet to come up with a space fighter that is a match for our contemporary jet aircraft, and as the RAF will tell you, it only takes a couple of hours in a flight simulator to become a pilot.I don't have a grading system for films about alien invasions, so instead I'll use my aquatic monster/cruise liner catastrophe marking system.Battlefield Earth: A Saga of the Year 3000 gets a reasonable 2 shrimps and a cuttlefish, which ranks it alongside Casablanca'.

So it finally landed in Netflix and I am 22 years late joining in the review.The movie is not that bad. I was of course tainted with what I have read about this movie over the years but then I saw one article that the production team did not think that this was a bad project and after watching it, I believe that they did set out to make a genuine SciFi movie.The costumes and practical effects looked good. They were not done lazily. It was obvious that the team did their best to create a planet overrun by alien beings.The story had potential and the movie had some good moments and all the actors did what they could with the material.As a huge Barry Pepper fan, this is obviously a lowlight on his portfolio but his performance here still showed how professional an actor he is. I may be biased because I just adore Barry but he did his best with Jonnie and the kind of direction that was given to him.It's an okay movie so I guess the hatred it got was really about John Travolta's ego or believing in this movie to much?
Can I give this a 0? I mean...what else is there to say...

I was excited when I heard they made the movie Battlefield Earth.  When I saw that it was only 121 min.  I was doubtful justice could be done to a book of  1050 pages.  I finished the book then rushed to see the movie.  I didn't think  I  would like it because of the length.  I was very disappointed.  I disliked it more than  I thought I would.  About the only similarity was the title and some characters names.  They took to many liberties with the story.  I find that even those who didn't read the book, didn't like it.  It should have been a  mini series 6 or 8 hours long.

easily the worst POS ever caught on film. don't waste your time. and certainly don't bother listening to anyone trying to enlighten you on it's socio-value or in-depth political statements. this movie is awful, awful crap and there's no way getting around it.

I've read some user comments who loved this movie and all I can say is I didn't know there were so many scientologists. Only a true believer could claim to like this movie to help Mr. Travolta recoupe some of the 80 MILLION dollars spent on the stinker.I've be participating in "Bad Cinema Night" with my friends for 10 years and this is the absolute worst movie ever.I get nervous flying in a brand new jet, but hey lets fire up a couple of 1000 year old fighters and take them for a spin!Holes in this movie are big enough to drive a planet through.Don't waste you time or money on this movie unless you take it as a poorly written comedy.

reviews.review_title: The CRITICS are right! This movie is terrible.
reviews.content:
Battlefield: EARTH is pure dreck. A sloppy, poorly thought out, ridiculously written disaster that rivals any previous Hollywood bomb in history. The movie makes little sense, has plotholes so glaring that only an infant could ignore them. The direction, acting, even the music is banal and boring and not even fun to laugh at. The consensus of critics is that this movie is awful and they're absolutely right. DO NOT waste your money on this whether in theaters or on video. You'll spend your time scratching your head and saying, "What?" and "Excuse me?" a lot as the film makers ignore logic and any intelligent thought to tell a completely ridiculous storyline. I never read the book and won't now for sure. The only people who could truly enjoy this film are ones who indulge in illegal substances before going to the movies.
As one reviewer said, the aliens on the Simpsons, Kodos and Kang seem to be the main inspiration for Travolta's character Terl. He overplays him as a complete idiot who hands victory to the hero on a silver platter. He's supposed to be the Head of Security for the Psyclo's on Earth but isn't bright enough to be Mr. Magoo. If they'd advertised this as HISTORY OF THE WORLD: YEAR 3000, they would have been more accurate and probably made more money than this stupid waste of film. If you must see it, buy tickets for another movie and sneak into B:E rather than pay any money to fools like the ones who made this mess.Dave

reviews.review_title: What in God's name is this?
reviews.content: Don't people read the screenplay before they start making the movie? Can someone please tell me how the human weapons still worked after all this time? Where did the electricity for the flight simulator come from? What was up with the tilted angle? Why the obvious rip-off from Blade Runner in the first chase scene? Why was this movie made? Why did I pay to go see it? These are questions that will never be answered. It is movies like this one that almost buried John Travolta in the 80s. Let us hope for his sake that this is the last one. He won't be getting another Pulp Fiction to save his name if he makes another piece of trash like this.

i am a great fan of Travolta but this movie must have been just for the money. It's impossible that Travolta could have been serious about this movie. Very very bad special effects considering we are living in the year 2000. This is one of those movies you really wanna walk out on.Never never and i mean never see this movie,maybe if you have trouble sleeping,then this might be the movie for you,believe me you will be asleep before you know it.

reviews.review_title: Only 1 good thing can come of this
reviews.content: It seems that after only 3 weeks this horrific movie is out of the top 10 (thank god), also I called the two remaining theaters in my town to see if they would be playing it next week and i got a resounding NO! As for that 1 thing that can come of this is a NEW ms3k movie toss mike and the bots in for an extra 100,000 and you may be able to recoup what it lost.

reviews.review_title: it was worth all 9 of the 10 possible while we were under the "green" influence =)
reviews.content: Anyways, after I saw the average that low, I was wondering what votes did get Jean Claude van Damme's "Knock Off" (1998) http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120724/ and the result was twice higher! =) I definitely fell asleep during that movie at the cinema but BE - totally different story.OK, I agree that John T. is a bit too high of a character to play in this movie - too easy for him I'd say. But money speaks for itself, does it not, John? ;)Well, I probably have to see it once again in "normal mode", but I'm sure it will not gain less than 5 from me even then.Have a blast!J.

I don't quite agree with the "worst film of the century" stamp this film came with, but maybe that's because I really expected the worst ever and could only be surprised in a positive way! Although being a fan of Sci-Fi, I only find the story so-so, plus I have a feeling that a lot of the points from the book got lost in translation (haven't read it). The sum is a story which is thin like "butter spread over too much bread" (or however Bilbo puts it), somehow hollow and fragmental. The plot seems sometimes going too fast and sometimes too slow. The worst thing is the special effects though. It's like these "Babylon 9" Star Trek spin-offs (I'm not that into sci-fi!). Some of the locations looks like they're filmed at my local rail-way station. Although steady, the quality of the picture is sometimes handy-camish. The only thing that kept me going through the movie (and kept me from giving it a 1 or 2) was that the acting only sucked a little (I'm a Forest Whitaker fan), some scenes were a little interesting to watch, plus the curiosity of seeing the "worst movie of the decade". To sum it up; I think Sci-Fi fans have endured worse moments than this. But maybe the people behind the movie (John Travolta?) should have waited for a bigger budget grant so that it could be made with contemporary effects plus more space for the story to develop in good pace.

Butchered doesn't even begin to describe how bad this movie was.  I tried to not look to critically at first, but it went on and on and on.  Jurassic Park the movie didn't follow the book, but it was a good movie, same with Starship Troopers (kind of...) BUT THIS WAS A TERRIBLE MOVIE.  Don't get me wrong though, Battlefield Earth the book is my all time favorite sci-fi story, so don't get turned off because of the movie.

reviews.review_title: an insult to movies, and one to my intellegence
reviews.content: The far fetched story line of this movie was only out done by the hype, concept, acting, and special effects.  This movie was hyped to be a special effects tour-de-force, while in reality, I saw better special effects on quite a few made for tv movies.BELOW IS A SPOILERThe previews proclaimed that the entire species was conquered in like 17 minutes or something, with that in mind, you would think that these aliens were extremely powerful, but in the end, the aliens are defeated by a bunch of semi-illiterate somewhat dumb humans-turned-slaves.  In the middle of the movie my friend and I left and took a breath, due to the fact that we were overwhelmed by stupidity.  An insult to your intellegence, and to your wallet.  The public spends billions of dollars every year on movies, and we deserve better than this.

I've seen many worse movies that got better reviews by IMDb users. That said, I think the main reason that this movie didn't get the good reviews that it could have gotten was that the script writers didn't follow the book very well. I've read the book several times, and loved it more every time. The same can't be said for repeat viewings of this movie. I applaud John Travolta for his intention to get the book made into a movie, but I feel that more time should have been taken in the scripting before the production started.Some basic corrections:The book is over 1000 pages long. You can't take the middle 300 pages and write the script from that without destroying your audience. The problem is, you're dropping them into the story with no background, and then cutting them off without the ending. Mr. Travolta, you should know better - this is one of the simplest mistakes to avoid. If more time would have been spent developing the Psychlo teaching machine, that would have handled nearly all of the criticism of the humans learning to fly Harrier jets and build bombs so quickly. Also, in the book Johnny had to do a lot of traveling (to other continents) and learn to speak several languages (with the Psychlo teaching machine and archive language tapes) to recruit his rebel force before he could train them. This wasn't covered in the movie at all. So, Mr. Travolta, if you want someone to help with a sequel, perhaps I'm your man. At least I am familiar with the storyline!Finally - people shouldn't be using IMDb movie reviews to beat the soapbox of religion - unless it is an integral plot point of the movie being reviewed. L. Ron Hubbard did start a religion - it is recognized in every court of the land as such (including the Supreme Court of the United States) - but it has nothing to do with this book/movie. Get over it. I have read better than half of the reviews on this movie, and the best that I can say about them is that most were written by illiterate cavemen/women who shouldn't be allowed access to computers! Perhaps that explains why this movie was reviewed so badly - it was over their heads! 7.5/10

reviews.review_title: Not what many seem to think it is...
reviews.content: Heh heh, I am amazed at how many thought this was horrible...from the moment I began watching, I could see the intent of the producers and the director. Battlefield Earth was never created to be an epic motion picture, but rather a spoof of just about every B scifi picture ever made.It has that "steam punk-ish" feel to it, yet has some really good special effects scenery. The actors play into the story line with a gusto, and there is never any doubt who the bad guy(s) are. Travolta plays the evil lead with beauty, reminiscent of the evil Warlord in Flash Gordon, heh heh...Come on guys, have a heart. This is creative movie making at it's best...yes, it is crude, rude and everything else...but it actually an entertaining flick...

reviews.review_title: Save your money, you worked too hard for it.
reviews.content: This is the most pitiful excuse for a mainstream, A rate movie that Hollywood has ever put out (wouldn't even be a good B rate movie for late night insomniac television).  I did not read the book, but if the movie is any indication, I will not waste my time with the book.The only redeeming factor for this movie is that I liked two of the actors: John Travolta and Forest Whitaker.  John plays 'Evil' pretty well, but the character was demeaning for him.  And as for Forest, this was a far cry from trying to start a jeep that the motor was already running in 'Good Morning Vietnam'.All in all, this movie cannot be properly ranked, as IMDB does not have a ranking system which indicates negative numbers.
It's a bad film yes but they should make a film similar to The Disaster Artist about this. It's a fun watch because it's so terrible and there's big names involved

In the year 3000 the Earth is dominated by gold-mining aliens. However the all but extinct human race is about to make one last bid for freedom!Based on the novel by scientologist L. Ron Hubbard Battlefield Earth is the critically panned project from John Travolta who had longed to make it & star as the hero Jonnie Goodboy Tyler. The advancing years meant that when finally given the green light he decided to play the evil alien Terl instead. He shouldn't have bothered. Pushing aside the claims that this movie is a recruitment drive for scientology it remains a contender for worst film in cinematic history!With any big Hollywood blockbuster suspension of disbelief is of course normal but even these movies should adhere to their own internal logic. Battlefield Earth has none! How on Earth did gold-loving aliens miss Fort Knox? How do cavemen learn to fly fighterplanes within a week? These are just a couple of the gaping plot holes in an already sparse script. They could be overlooked if the film had good fx, acting & action scenes to cover the flaws but alas it does not. Everything has been seen before & been done better, from the post-apocalyptic ruins of Earth to the spacecraft dogfights. The aliens themselves appear to have stepped out of a 1960s episode of Star Trek with make-up consisting of dreadlocks, joke-shop monster gloves & KISS reject big boots. This is not helped by the laughable panto-style acting & unintentionally hilarious dialogue.The man responsible for this film is Roger Christian. He has previously worked with George Lucas but this film doesn't compare favourably with any of the Lucasfilm output & that includes Howard The Duck!  He has used the familiar wipes from the Star Was films again & again & again. For no visible purpose other than the fact that he can do it. The other remaining trick up his directorial sleeve is an unnecessary & bizarre over-reliance on slo-mo. This may have been used to try & add something to the uninspired action scenes.Overall this is that rare thing, a movie totally devoid of merit! It would be hard pushed to cut the mustard as a cheap Saturday morning cartoon let alone a full length feature-film. As such it really should be avoided.

reviews.review_title: I swear I missed something...not about the film, about the audience
reviews.content:
I understand we live in a society of followers.  Battlefield Earth is the unfortunate victim of this.  Every critic and "expert" (note me rolling my eyes) tore this movie to shreds.But you know what?  I liked this movie a lot...in fact, so did a large portion theater I saw it in on opening night.  They cheered on the action sequences, they laughed at the right places (no, that doesn't include Travolta's head), and overall, I think most of them felt they got their money worth.The theater hadn't emptied out by the end of the movie with people running for refunds (I've seen that happen before, it ain't pretty ;) ).  I thought this movie would do pretty well, from that first night turnout, BUT??
Yep, big time backlash against the movie, L Ron Hubbard, etc.  I can't say why exactly,   Considering how little this movie made, it's amazing the sheer number of people who have said it's the worst movie ever made. Yeah, yeah, I know, video release, Blah, blah, but this movie had a pretty large number of detractors even before its release.  Negative rumors and outright lies filled the Internet well before it had even really started production.My review?  Good story, pretty good acting, and an excellent translation of a book I never thought a good movie could be made out of.  I'd give the movie a 7 or 8, but of course, I've actually seen it so I can give it a fair grade.For now on, I want everyone to try and watch movies with an open mind. Don't allow garbage like Mummy Returns to make 70 million in one weekend while good movies like Battlefield Earth, Memento, and Waterworld suffer.And enough with this nonscence about only intelligent people can enjoy this movie, or posting your SAT scores to prove you're intelligent and still hated this movie.  The fact you've taken the SAT means you should (SHOULD) have grown out of these childish arguments.

reviews.review_title: Hands down the worst sci-fi (as opposed to SF) movie I've ever seen.
reviews.content: Would rate a zero if I could give it one.  Unintentionally funny, but without the excuse of a low budget.  Travolta's performance was fully as bad as his costuming.  Plot holes and logical flaws exemplify a script that stinks like "breathe-gas" (where did those snot-tubes go, to find a ready source of methane?

Once in a great while a film comes along that makes you appreciate the films that you thought were bad, but seem masterful in comparison to this abomination.  John Travolta's pet project Battlefield Earth is an unintentionally funny masterpiece.  It is rolling around in its bloated budget and hammy acting, basking gleefully in its own filth.  The film is based on a bestselling novel from scientologist L. Ron Hubbard.  Being a film student, I watch this film with constant grin on my face as I try to figure out why the cinematography felt it was necessary to shoot the entire film in a canted camera angle.  Granted, that canted shots create mood, but the entire film is slanted.  The chiropractors across America will make the most money from this film, since whoever views Battlefield Earth will receive strong neck discomfort.  A special edition DVD should be released which has a feature that straightens the film horizontally.  This film is not only a $70 million dollar catastrophe, but is so bad that it may become immortalized.  Every bad film will be compared to this film for years to come.  Walking out of this film I was absolutely positive this was the worst film in nearly a decade.  One enjoyable way to watch this film is to take it from a comedic point of view.  Travolta constantly says "leverage," and "rat-brain."  Why?  I don't know, but boy is it funny.

This is how it was necessary to mock a book novel. There are no words. I thought worse than the ninth episode of Star Wars, there is nothing. But I was wrong. Well, why not restart Battle Field Earth according to the book, with a time of two hours and a half and let it be a trilogy. Such a skilled director as Peter Jackson would have shot an excellent trilogy, he knows how.

When I was younger my dad gave me a book to read, the titleBattlefield Earth by L. Ron Hubbard. Iread the entire book in 2 hours (1050 pages). It was by and far one of the best novels I have ever read. When I heard they were coming out with a movie, I figured with the technology they have today it would do the book at least marginal justice. BIG MISTAKE. I know movies are almost never as good as the books they are based on, but to make a movie that has almost nothing to do with the book, come on. There are a whole lot of people who will never read the book now because of this mockery of a movie. The only things that matched the book were Johnny leaving the mountains and Terl as head of Security and the idea of the gold. I am just glad that L. Ron Hubbard didn't live to see this movie. It probably would have killed him. I give every movie a chance, but this is the worst movie I have seen.Total Action + NO STORY = GarbageI just hope people will forget about this movie and read the book. (Small chance now that it has the Movie pictures on it's cover).The book is a fast paced action with everything you could want in a story. The movie is fast paced action with no storyline, no character builders and approximately .000000000000000000000000000001% of the book.I give this movie two thumbs down. Save an hour and a half of your life. DON'T SEE IT.

reviews.content:
One of the worst so-called science fiction films ever. It signalled to Disney that crap like The Farce Awakens is OK to be released. in this turkey a 10,000 year old jet fires up, flies and is piloted by a neanderthal human.
In Disney so-called Star Wars by Jar Jar Abrams a Mary Sue with ugly masculine hair who is an orphan and deals in scrap takes a space ship and within an hour pilots better than its master who is an experienced pilot

reviews.review_title: A solid contender for the worst movie ever made
reviews.content: The best part of the DVD is the interview with John Travolta where he discusses the movie with a straight face.It's definitely the best acting displayed anywhere on the Special Edition DVD. Of course, there is the possibility that he actually believes what he's saying, but he must not have ever watched the movie, if that's the case.
