There is a lot to swallow in this movie, as in all sci-fi movies, but this was a just too much. Now, the overall plot isn't that bad I suppose.  From what people tell me, some of it doesn't make sense because parts from the book were deleted. HOW BIG IS THIS BOOK?  It's slated to be a trilogy and you can't have the movies make sense?  Anyways, I can accept that Johnny Goodboy whatever could learn stuff that fast (after all, I accepted that Neo could learn that fast in Matrix, didn't I?), but how does he teach hundreds, if not thousands of people just as fast?  And why, in the year 2000, do we have a bomb that one person could carry (Is this the "suitcase bomb" from "Wag the Dog"?) that blows up (and I mean BLOWS UP) a planet which is supposed to be much much bigger than ours?  And how many people and Psychlos are we dealing with here?  That never seems clear to me, and most of the final battle scene just completely escaped me unless there was a main character in it. Speaking of characters, what was Travolta doing here?  I wasn't able to tell if we were supposed to laugh at him or be afraid of him.  That stupid laugh was funnier and less purposeful than Dr. Evil's, I mean throw me a frickin' bone here.  Other than that, I didn't think the acting was too bad.For some reason though, I was able to watch this movie without getting too upset.  Perhaps it's because Pitch Black had already lowered my expectations of Sci-Fi movies, but when I was watching the movie, I turned my brain off, and only since I've had time to digest it have I gotten so mad.  Unlike everyone else, the tilted screen really didn't bother me that much, it wasn't like it was Blair Witch or anything.  So that is why this does not get into the "Pitch Black"/"Daylight" levels and I give this a 4 out of 10, and I would attribute that to the special effects.

I really liked the movie.  It had great action and special effects.  I thought Travolta did a very good job of creating Terl, the alien Psyclo. Mr. Hubbard put together some fantastic characters for the book. Its a great story!

reviews.review_title: Better with age and by comparison
reviews.content: If you have exhausted your never seen Sci Fi films and haven't considered BFE, then this is worth your time. Since its release there have been a slew of really bad Sci-fi, especially if you have sat through the Sci-Fi channel releases and made for DVD. This had a budget and it shows. It amounts to a bad Hollywood Movie, but it at least qualifies as a legitimate film. Yes bad, but much better then most of the terribly bad Sci-Fi. And spiritual what? Its just a save earth from the aliens movie... If ID4 didn't come out first or at all... This movie would have had a life of its own and still might build a cult following over time...

I enjoyed the flick. Travolta was the highlight.  It wasn't 2001, but I don't think the movie takes itself that seriously.  It was a fun show. Effects were great.  I recommend catching it on the big screen.

I saw the film again and I enjoyed it a lot more. I think that everyone should give it a second chance. They should have stayed more faithful to the book. The book's still dumb but at least tries to explain things. Pity there won't be a sequel.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst film I've ever seen, but...
reviews.content: I really wanted to love this film. I'd heard all the negative reviews and I'd hoped that it was all down to prejudice against L. Ron Hubbard. I'd seen the trailers and it looked good. The clips I'd seen looked good. But the film as a whole just doesn't work. I won't even try to list all the things that are wrong with this film because there's a 1000 word limit on this. I think that the thing that really sunk it was the lack of humour, if there had been a few good one-liners it would've lifted the whole thing. When you think of a great film, you always think about certain scenes. Sexy scenes, funny scenes or gobsmacking action scenes. But this film has none of the above. Some of the action scenes might have been impressive if they hadn't been ruined by the overuse of slow motion. All in all, the film was ruined by the script's reliance on contrived situations. It was too easy for the heroes to save the day. If only someone with a decent grasp of the English language had given the script a quick once over, then maybe we might have been spared this monstrosity. But on the plus side, John Travolta gave a good performance as Terl, considering the useless, stupid character he was given to play. If only Terl had been as clever as he thought he was then the film might have worked. Might have. And Kelly Preston was a very sexy Psychlo. Still, having said all of this, I'm planning to see it again. It might improve with repeat viewing. It's not the worst film ever made, but it is a letdown. Warner Bros. must be getting sick of always the studio that delivers the turkeys.

I must disagree with those who equate criticism of this film with religious intolerance:  there are so many reasons to dislike Battlefield Earth, I don't think it's even necessary to discuss the  religious beliefs of it's makers.  The film is plenty putrid in it's own right.Okay, I kinda liked the cavemen learning to fly the 1000 year-old Harrier jets in 7 days...but other than that, the film doesn't even stand up as silly summer dreck.I hate to quibble, but why is it that in the future everyone feels the need to tie strips of cloth around their triceps? This keeps showing up in these science fiction films, and I haven't seen any rational explanation for it. I knew I was in real trouble when Bon Jovi showed up here with an armstrip. I had a bad flashback to Alien 4, where everyone  was tying strips around their arms, presumably to ward off alien attack...and then I  remembered "Staying Alive" the truly dreadful dance film that Travolta made following up Saturday Night Fever, where JT posed his little buns off with the most aggregious armstrips ever put on film. What's with that?By all means, stay home from this film...or find a second-run theatre still showing 'Pitch Black' if you have a real hankering for pumped-up B-grade Science Fiction.  Amazing what Vin Deisel pulls off in that film with 25 words of dialogue and not an armstrip in sight.   --josh

reviews.review_title: So many scientific holes for science based religion flick
reviews.content: OK. Aliens come in and dominate the human population. OK I can buy it. Some humans escape and basically become caveman and woman again. OK far fetched but giving the whole conquering of us maybe I can buy it. Here's were it gets really bad. There is a line in the movie where Travolta boasts about how it took only but 9 minutes to conquer the Earth". Keep this line in mind as you read the rest of this. The alien beings are powerful and seem to know a lot about the Earth history and historical figures. Yet they couldn't figure out that the primary mineral they are there to collect (gold) has its largest concentration in Fort Knox. They were so intelligent they could pick up any version of an encyclopedia to look up the word gold and have a greater understanding of where the earth's already mined supply's are. Then Jet fuel has an expiration date of about 50 years. Yet many many years later it still holds the chemical balance to work in these aircraft that the caveman humans learn to fly in 2 weeks. Oh wait I hear it again "9 Minutes to conquer the Earth". Then caveman take a crash course on how to fly a jet and use the gold from fort knox to buy the time. From caveman to fighter jet pilot is a huge leap of evolution my friend. My grandfather was a pilot and this movie is a pure comedy to him. Oh OK, say we are complete morons and buy all the crap that has been spooned fed to us at this point. Now an alien nation that was so far advanced that (yes the 9 minute thing)conquered us. And you figure their advancements from that point would have increased even to higher levels. yet they end up getting their butts kicked by caveman pilots in obsolete jets with expired fuel to end the movie. So basically the technology that got its but kicked almost 1000 years ago is now the ultimate weapons again. Its like us getting into a huge war with Iceland and Iceland breaks out the catapult and destroys us. Nice work Travolta and L Ron Hubbard. If you have a religion with science in the name you might want to do some scientific research on your own film before you release it to the public. Can you say F-. Nope, I can't, the humor in its flaws alone bump it up to an F.

I thoroughly enjoyed this movie.  It is fast paced, the characters are great and it is very entertaining.   The plot does not follow the book exactly and that may disappoint some of the fans of the book, but watch the movie for what it is.  The spirit and feeling of heroism and hope that one can find throughout the book are definitely there in the movie.
Travolta and Pepper are tremendous together. Most action films don't have depth of character, but this one does. The evil Terl is totally evil and Johnny is an uncompromising hero.A most enjoyable film for the summer.

reviews.review_title: I'VE READ THE BOOK. I SAW THE FILM FOUR TIMES.
reviews.content: Battlefield Earth is a very unique film. I consider myself a movie buff and I've never been so entertained by the intelligent making of a movie! I completely understand why Travolta called it the "Pulp Fiction of the Year 3000". There is so much to get out of this film and that's why I saw it four times. It's an intelligent person's film and so I also completely comprehend why the critics don't like it. They can't begin to understand it!! The direction of the photography was brilliant! There are so many scenes within scenes. And you really have to pay attention and follow the sequences. See it again and again and it only gets better and better! Once you conquer the sequences its a "piece of cake!" (A line from the movie). Travolta again has made movie history. His lines in this movie will rock down the ages as unforgettable. I'm already hearing them among those who have seen the movie and some who have only seen the trailers!! And the movie was true enough to L. Ron Hubbard's best-selling novel by the same title. I believe the sequel (or trilogy as it will most likely take 2 more movies to complete the awe inspiring second half of the book) will only be more exciting as the story unfolds into an unbelievable action packed adventure and final confrontation. Really the BATTLE has only just BEGUN!! Kudos to the entire cast, director, producers, and all who had anything to do with getting this movie made!! Thank-you!! You were a breath of fresh air in a sometimes smoggy and confused world!!

reviews.review_title: Poor adaptation of a cheesy book.
reviews.content: I read a lot of science fiction and, regardless of how much the Church of Scientology buys Hubbard's books to keep them on bestseller lists and regardless of how Scientologists stuff the Amazon book review forums, a turkey is a turkey. The book "Battlefield Earth" is such an amateurish and corny attempt at the space epic form it's hard to believe that anyone past puberty would find it appealing. But don't take my word for it. Buy it, and see for yourself. Don't say you weren't warned.That being said, good movies can be made from sub-par material. Sadly, "Battlefield Earth: A Saga Of The Year 3000" is not such a movie. There's a very good reason why this movie's rated so low (2.4 -- #27 on "The Bottom 100" list!) by so many people (12,813, as of this post) on IMDb, people who by and large are quite generous to sci-fi films, even inept ones.And the reason is this: this movie disappointed a LOT of folks, folks who really enjoy watching movies. Scientologists might argue that this film was unfairly received and is actually a misunderstood interpretation of great masterpiece, but the fact remains that, as a sci-fi epic, this movie was judged by its target audience to be a product of unacceptably poor quality.

I doubt it possible for a frequent movie viewer to be without any preconceptions of this movie. It has to be one of the most talked about "Bombs" in the history of cinema. Even so, you can enjoy it.....no really! Read on.....Fool yourself. Pretend that this is a gloriously deliberately tongue-in-cheek farce of a movie ( Think the later Nightmare On Elm Street pictures ), and you may actually come out the other side with a grin on your face. Try and take it seriously and judge it by any cinematic scale other than the Stupidfunnypieceofcrapometer, and disappointment will leave a bitter taste on your tongue as it fails to come close to describing the feelings that viewing this lemon seem to inspire in everybody but the most rabid Scientologists.John. For shame.

reviews.review_title: This movie made me want to die...
reviews.content: Words cannot describe how bad this film is!Having said that though, the sense of relief when the credits finally rolled was both blissful and overwhelming. I could take the gun out my mouth and put down the lit match that was ready to send my petrol-soaked body up in flames, I was going to live after all! To truly appreciate what is good about life, maybe we do have to experience things this terrible.Joking aside, this is one seriously poor film. From the plot-by-numbers, human-race-rises-up-against-oppressors storyline to the evil aliens and all-American hero, cliché follows cliché without any real attempt to differentiate from or improve on any of the films that have visited this ground before. Throw in a cast that look bored and uninspired from start to finish, characters that make a zebra crossing look colorful, a script so banal it'll make you cringe and the result is a turkey that rightfully deserves a place on the list of worst movies ever made.

reviews.review_title: This is the worst movie I've ever seen.
reviews.content: In the top five worst movies of all time, this is definitely in the top 3.I can't believe John Travolta's power is such that he could actually get someone to make this piece of c**p.Totally amazing.  You'd think somewhere along the way a person in power would have said "ENOUGH!" and put a stop to it.

reviews.review_title: I really enjoyed this first installment of the terrific book.
reviews.content: The movie, based on the epic book, picks up the flavour of Buck Rogers in terms of the overall "colour" of that era and movies from that time. The story was engrossing and kept me wanting to know more. I even saw it a second time and found it even better the second viewing.

Battle Field Earth is one of those movies that in the long run will become a classic Sci Fi movie and seen as very innovative. The sets, the camera angles, the CG work are all way more than you ever see in most movies.

Well...it makes a great comedy though, it has alot of flaws but if Roger Christian had stick to the novel I think BE will be a classic summer hit movie. Its rather ludicrous that1 nuke can blow Psychlo into nothing...I dun think even the Death Star could even do thatI read the novel BE, I love the idea of it...Man forgetting all their scientific advancements and technology and being enslaved by aliens and 1 day launch a rebellion against their alien masters and win...but then again...u get this kind of stories all the time in the Bible...hehehe

Just saw this and have to pass it along:  Commenting on Gladiator winning for Best Picture at the Academy Awards Sunday (March 25), Roeper told KABC-TV( Channel 7) Los Angeles entertainment reporter George Pennacchio in a recent aired interview that ``I think Battlefield Earth had better special effects than Gladiator.''  Ebert, concurring, said ``It did. It did,'' then reiterated that Battlefield Earth -- like Gladiator, released theatrically last year -- ``had better special effects.''

reviews.review_title: The DVD of Battlefield Earth is something special.
reviews.content: My own personal opinion is quite different than the critics.  The critics went way overboard--as usual.  Does anybody really listen to the critics--I hope not.  This DVD really has some good stuff on it.  the commentary is special because you are getting inside data on how the movie was made and various details from the director and art director.  It was very cool to see the behind the scenes shots and the interviews from the people involved with the movie.  I also liked the movie itself--it is true sci fi.  The special effects were well-done and amazing when you consider the budget of $20 million to make the movie itself--including the special effects shots. The DVD was number 2 on the charts--so obviously others agree. Check it out.

reviews.review_title: fun to hate but really not all that rank!
reviews.content: C'mon everybody! Slow down a bit! If this was a Roger Corman production, made in 1980 by New World or something, it would be a freaking cult classic. The  main reason everybody trashes this flick is that it's a way bloated "dream project" for a megalomaniacal scientologist. It's not a great movie at all, but it's a fairly competent one and it's not boring. The effects are pretty damn good and Travolta is amusing. Every theme in this flick has been exploited better in other films but , Hollywood politics aside, this is far from the worst. What about the unwatchable Supernova? Mission to Mars was worse. Target your hatred elsewhere.

The only thing good about this movie is the camera, its really high quality and makes the film look like an actual blockbuster, and also i like the name, but other than that nothing is good about this movie, from character design, story, script, setting, special effects, and even the poster, i've seen really horrible movies but those are almost all independent or made to be bad, this was distributed by Warner Bros! You would think they would check for quality! I though Marvel films were bad, or Godzilla 98, I thought that was as bad as big studio films get, mockbusters, uwe boll films, and nostalgia critic skits are better than this film! This isn't the worst film i've seen, Empire takes that place, nor is the director the worst, Neil Breen takes that place,but those are both independent, this is the worst big studio film i've ever seen, but not bottom 10 but bottom 100, i hate this film.

This film must surely become a cult classic. John T playing his usual cool self, strange special effects and those great boots.  I had read many reviews saying this film was dire, but hadn't enjoyed a film so much for ages. A lot seems to have been crammed into the last 20 minutes or so, as if they started to run out of time, but overall I really enjoyed it.

No bones about it, Battlefield Earth is a bad film.  And you know it right away -- from the moment Pepper throws himself on the ground and yells "NO!!!!" And it pretty much stays bad from start to finish.  The story, the camera work (what was with that wacky angle in every shot?), the acting -- it would be impossible to list everything wrong with it.
But, to be perfectly honest, and I'm amazed to say it,  Battlefield Earth was not a boring bad film.  And as for Travolta's over-the-top approach? With an outfit like that on, and lines like that, what else was he gonna do? At least, he seemed to have a little fun with it -- and, ultimately, I guess I did too. A little. Very little.

Travolta is a very talented actor, but this was far beyond his reach. Barry Pepper and Forest Whitaker were also wasted in this overhyped flop of a sci-fi. It's sad that the special effects were so good in this movie and that they wasted so much money on them. Who knows, maybe Tarantino will rescue him again.

The major flaw is that you can't make a 2 hour movie, out of a 1000+ pages book. It happened to Troy as well! Remember? I would admit that the acting could have been much better given the actors involved, at least given their names... Also, the movie manages to make the aliens so stupid, I would hardly imagine they only needed 9 minutes to conquer earth. The 1000 years old planes, m16, nukes, and so on are another Big blunder of the movie. Not to mention the flight simulator, as someone already said, was powering form WHERE? There are indeed too many errors in this movie, too much money down the drain. I cannot understand how you can direct a movie, and not stop and think that it would be impossible for a caveman to fly a supersonic in just one week. At least give me a DAMN good reason to believe that! Anyone smart enough to conquer earth in 9 minutes would stop and think, how could the humans melt the gold in bars, without the technology to do so? It's like a cow who comes and gives you the milk already bottled, and you shout at it about the time it had to do the job :)Simply awful, yet, the movie had some potential. And it is not underrated, it is simply a bad movie. Even if the book were great, the movie should have been MUCH better!

reviews.review_title: Sci-Fi fans read this. Some people gave this high reviews on IMDb? I will explain.
reviews.content: Now I'm not a person who likes all sorts of bad movies. For instance I think that "Dragonball: Evolution" and the American version of "Death Note" were disasters. I don't just like all movies, so hear my thoughts on this one.There are a bunch of high reviews here for this movie. A small percentage of people actually like this movie and I happen to be on of them. If you have the correct expectations and you're a hardcore Sci- Fi fan, then you may sincerely be one of the people can enjoy this.WHAT TO EXPECT: This is a low-budget post-apocalyptic Sci-Fi with over the top script and acting. It's done more in an old-school style instead of going for realism like movies nowadays (for instance Nolan's Batman trilogy, which tries to be realistic).As a huge Sci-Fi fan, I liked the movie because it has what I wanted form it: Futuristic visuals and a post-apocalyptic story. Visually I enjoyed the alien spaceship designs and certain environments (such as the alien colonial base and city ruins) even if they were low- budget. The post-apocalyptic story is interesting, it follows one the most known Sci-Fi novels. Personally I haven't read the novel, so can't comment on that much.The first 5 minutes leaves the worst impression (acting and script wise), but it got interesting after the aliens come in.BOTTOM LINE. HERE IS THE KEY POINT: I wasn't bothered by the acting or the script BECAUSE... Being a Sci- Fi fan, the post-apocalyptic story and futuristic visuals made this into an enjoyable experience, even if the script and acting isn't what you would call Oscar worthy. That's why some people really like this movie. Most people are extremely disappointed with the acting, dialogues and cheap visuals. So much that it's considered the worst movie ever. Based on my review, if you think you can enjoy it for what it is, give it a chance.

The original premise is kind of cool I guess. Seems realistic that humans would go all religious about the invaders, and it's a nice touch that the scavenger humans assume the massive statues are ancient humans who were turned into stone.I mostly just wanted to point out a major, gaping plot hole I've not seen mentioned much - why do the aliens seem to think humans are a primitive species incapable of anything beyond the most basic manual labour, so much so they find it completely inconceivable that one could fire a gun, when THERE ARE CITIES FULL OF SKYSCRAPERS EVERYWHERE? John Travolta even mentions a military confrontation when the invaders arrived.Not to mention they don't seem to think it's weird that "man animals" have exactly the same anatomy as themselves, the only real difference being height and eye colour.

reviews.review_title: So bad it is barely/painfully funny
reviews.content: I convinced friends to go see it in theaters when it came out hoping it would be a decent Sci fi movie, it was a very decent waste of time and money; even now 23 years later I still have friends angry with me and holding me personally accountable for how bad of a movie it is, it is apparently my fault because I was the one who made the suggestion to see it, in my defense we saw it when it had just barely released prior to it getting the negative reputation that might have made us choose something else to see, as it is I am now the one who suggested we go see Battlefield Earth, I would suggest this movie as one to see if you are for some reason interested in seeing an example of a truly bad movie, or perhaps if you want to punish someone by making them watch it.

reviews.review_title: gripping, fast-paced--you have to pay attention
reviews.content: Strong idea, pretty well executed.  It is hard to show aliens who aren't just warmed-over humans interacting with humans.  Does a good job, unlike Star Wars (not to put it down) where all characters are humans in dress-up. This one works.A lot to pack into movie-time, so the pace is fairly extreme in many spots--get your snacks before the movie.

OK, Those were not MIGs, they were Harriers. Now this was a waist of money, If you have read the book you'll agree with me. they left out a whole lot of things and change more. I actually recommend this for people who like to see crappy movie based on good books. L. Ron Hubbard wrote a good book yet it was turned into a piece-o-crap movie. please Stop doing this movie producers. Its already beginning to happen with the Harry Potters. OK i have said enough. Create good movies Please! We need some good movies. Maybe get the splinter cell movie up. now that would make a good movie. Whos producing it? L Ron Hubbard is an excellent author and a good person

Great Sci-Fi epic on paper. I loved the book and would recommend it to any Sci-Fi fan. But the film? As I look, its rated as the 75th worst film of all time here at the IMDB, and that about sums it up.Perhaps if you hadn't read the book it might not seem quite so bad - but then again...Too much of the story was missed out, skipped over or badly presented. My wife, who hasn't read the book, found much of the movie to be very confusing.

reviews.review_title: Funny one-liners and good special effects
reviews.content: I enjoyed the sense of humor in the movie.  Some of the one liners just cracked me up and the special effects are really good.  I took my daughter with me and she loved the movie.  She made my husband take her again and now she is trying to talk us into seeing it a third time.  It is a fun, entertaining and unique movie.

I read about this movie when it came out in the U.S ( that´s some bad reviews! ) and when it opened in Sweden a couple of weeks later I went to see it. Afterwards I thought to myself : wow ,that´s a bad movie! but still, I was entertained. Let me explain this to you:"Battlefield Earth" is definitely one of the worst movies of the 90´s. The dialogue is awful and the acting is laughable. I wonder what John Travolta was thinking about when he decided to make this movie! Barry Pepper and Forest Whitaker are usually great actors and they´re pretty decent in this one too, but eventually you´ll end up wondering what the hell they´re doing in this mess. The directing by Roger Christian is very old-fashioned and pretty average. It makes you feel like you´re watching an old episode of Star Trek or a b-version of Star Wars.Anyway, there´s one positive thing about this movie: the special effects. The visual effects are not superb, but they´re good enough to entertain you and make you stay awake for two hours.Otherwise, this is an overblown sci-fi turkey with a predictable story and no suspense. Barely worth a look, unless you´re in the mood for some dumb, pointless entertainment!

While this movie will not win an Academy Award, to say the least, there were several elements of the film that I did like, and are worth mentioning.First of all, Travolta's Terl character was just hilarious.  Travolta intentionally plays Terl over-the-top as a super-evil villain who is constantly scheming to outdo his fellow alien invaders in an effort to get off of Planet Earth and back to his beautiful purple home planet.  You just got to laugh when Terl tries to figure out the favorite food of the humans, and using all his wit and "brilliance" figures that it's got to be raw rat. Of course, all of Terl's schemes usually backfire at some point.In the novel, Hubbard puts a definite mocking spin on Terl's character, and Travolta carries that through to the movie very well.  Also, Forrest Whittaker does a very commendable job as the underdog Ker, and plays well off of Travolta's evilness as Terl.In summary, I would say that the film definitely had some enjoyable elements that made up for some of the less inspired parts.  Worth a watch.

I can't say much for the overall film, and actually I think most aspects have already been covered adequately in other posts.  But there is one facet I did want to mention, and that is Travolta's great rendition of Terl.While some people have said that Travolta played Terl over-the-top unintentionally, I remember that the novel has the same sort of tongue in cheek rendition of Terl.  He is always working on some new dastardly plan to outwit his fellow compatriots, and in the book one can't help but laugh at Terl's ridiculously evil lines and plots.I think Travolta nailed the Terl character perfectly, and I found him really entertaining and down-right funny.  Furthermore, I think that is how Travolta meant to play it.  Travolta is definitely having a good time in this film, and I was always entertained while he was on the screen.  So if for no other reason but to see Travolta play a great over-the-top evil maniac, Battlefield Earth could be entertaining.

reviews.review_title: If you can get past the flaws it is not...
reviews.content: all that bad. Sure the story is really weak, and they fly around in planes that have been left for thousands of years. It is somewhere between bad and okay. The only problem, I have is that they are actually talking about making a sequel to this. It is not that bad but it sure does not deserve a sequel.

reviews.review_title: Did the director shoot the entire film without looking at it???
reviews.content: Everyone I talked to told me this was the worst movie ever so I decided to check it out because I couldn't believe it was as bad as people were saying. Now I can truthfully say that they were understating the truth. This film is downright atrocious. All through the movie I kept praying for it to end. The direction, acting, editing, everything was just downright HORRIBLE.Everyone that I have read here seems to have covered the hundreds of things that are wrong with this film from the endless 45 degree camera angles to the gaping plot holes about the 1000 year old harrier jets, which just happen to be in perfect working order. Therefore I won't comment any further on that, but I felt I just had to put my two cents in here. Everyone involved in this movie (If you want to call it a movie) should be ashamed for participating in the first place. It was as if the entire story was written on cocktail napkin one afternoon. Finally I just have to say it. Where are Mike and the bots when we need them?!!!!! This film only proves yet again that we need MST3K to put turkeys like this in their proper place!

reviews.review_title: Very entertaining classic style science fiction
reviews.content: This was very entertaining classical science fiction coupled with great state of the art effects. The book was absolutely my favorite Science Fiction piece. I also enjoyed the soundtrack and will most definitely buy the DVD when it does come out.I thought the whole thing was pulled off rather well!

The most appropriate word I could find for this film is "Ouch".  My husband was kind enough to offer his sentiment by way of saying "I feel like I just fell down a flight of stairs."  This movie was so appalling that he went on to add that he felt he had just been "run over by the Stupid Truck."  What more can we say.

I'm a long-time (40 years) science fiction lover who's never been able to get past the first five pages of an L. Ron Hubbard book.  So, I went to this movie with low expectations, but thinking it might be fun to make fun of (in the spirit of Mystery Science Theater 3000).  Well, it wasn't even any fun. Why?  Lots of people have listed the deficiencies here and I haven't seen a negative comment that wasn't deserved.  Warning to people who are motivated to go for the same reason I did; wait til this is available on TV. Over-consumption of alcoholic beverages may also help make this a less painful experience, as some of the higher functions of the brain will be inhibited.If you DO see it in the theater, for god's sake, wear earplugs.  The soundtrack was deafening!John Thompson

reviews.review_title: Great being able to watch Battlefield Earth on DVD
reviews.content: What I enjoy about this film, and now even more as I can watch it on DVD, is that I see more facets.  There are different levels to the comedy and the irony.  It's good to be able to take a good laugh at ourselves because, let's face it, there's a bit of Psychlo in all of us!

reviews.review_title: A good effort even if it didn't satisfy everyone who liked the book
reviews.content: I think Roger Christian should be acknowledged for trying to bring something new and different to the film. I would have preferred that the script adapt some of the elements of the book differently (it's a wonderful book) but it's certainly not the same slick middle-of-the-road boring film-making that mostly clogs up the theaters. So what if every idea he tried didn't work. At least Christian tried them and a lot of them worked. I'm keeping my Terl doll in the original box.

reviews.review_title: Science fiction that's beyond the realm of logic
reviews.content: This film is evidence that the renowned author and cult leader, Hubbard must have been totally detached from reality.  He was well schooled and had an engineering background, so you would expect a little accuracy in his story elements, yet there are many gross oversights. I have a lot of difficulty with the thousand years of degeneration in regards to the earth's equipment and power supplies.  The military couldn't build a plane that could sit for even a hundred years without needing a complete overhaul.  The flight simulator not only was fully operational, but could teach illiterate men to fly (and possibly maintain) F-15s and Herriers better than some enlisted soldiers. Fort Knox has to have better security than an average bank, which should befuddle even a handy-man with an awesome set of tools; yet our Neanderthal heroes seem to have walked right in to the well lit vault like it was McDonalds. During the finale, the humans seemed to instantly figure out the Psyclo weaponry that had previously baffled the best of them.  I didn't get the impression that many of them had even ridden horses, so they adapted well to aerial combat against greatly advanced aircraft, even doing victory rolls at the appropriate time. Aside from the goofy camera tilting in every city scene, the special effects were well done and the makeup artists should get some kudos; but regretfully this is the only bright spot in a lame story line. I would prefer to call it a "Science Fairytale".

reviews.review_title: Travolta perfect evil; effects perfect reality.
reviews.content: How perfectly evil is Travolta, as really evil people have to be really, really stupid.  And this Travolta puts into the villian perfectly.  And the destruction of planet Psychlo, perfection effects.  Better than the death of the Death Star by far.  Too bad Chrissy has no more character development than she did.  My only disappointment.

I really enjoyed Battlefield Earth.  Not just for getting to see John Travolta as a truly repulsive alien slimeball, but the story grabbed my attention throughout and the special effects were outstanding. If you'd like a wild ride through a frightening future with unconventional heroes battling even more unusual villains, you'll like this one.

Battlefield Earth by L Ron Hubbard. I thought that the movie was well cast and had a great message that intelligence will win over force and that the villain will usually do himself in.  I would highly recommend the book as Mr. Hubbard lays out some great images that were not in the movie.  J.T. I truly enjoyed. Peppers' portrayal of Johnny our hero's quest for freedom, very believable. I thought it was a brave undertaking as the book is vast in its concepts and a must for Science Fiction lovers. I will see it again!

Battlefield Earth written by L.Ron Hubbard was well cast and held true to the book.  I would highly recommend to all Science Fiction buffs to read the book.  Mr. Hubbard has some pretty wild images that he lays out that were not in the movie. J.T. portrays a great villain, completely unprincipled. Our hero Barry Pepper takes you on his quest for freedom.  Peppers' character would battle to the death for his freedom rather then succumb to the fate that has befallen man. There are parts that the emotion wells up and your recognition that intelligence will win over force. That an organized body of intelligent beings with a well thought out plan that follows its leaders quest for freedom wins. See Battlefield Earth, read Battlefield Earth by L. Ron Hubbard

Jump in and be ready to move fast through the plot. I found it definitely fun,worth the trip.  If you read the book following it will be a lot easier. If you haven't read it I'd recommend reading the book then seeing the movie again. Easily as good as Phantom Menace and a good one just for fun.

I'm giving this movie a high rating, perhaps because I was expecting a dud, but got a quite good movie.  I've had it sitting around for quite a few weeks, because I expected it to be bad and a waste of my time.  However, I finally sat down to see it, and it's amazing how much I disagree with the "critics" reviews.I advise you to judge by yourself.  Don't just go with the flow that led many people pass it by. Rentals are cheap, so give this movie a try.

reviews.review_title: Flawed, but good fun. 3 of 5 stars
reviews.content: Battlefield Earth suffers from two primary flaws: horrible dialogue, and a touch of predictability.  The dialogue seems childish, and often overuses modern cliches, which seems painfully out of place in the future setting (e.g. an alien saying "don't blow a head gasket")  Predictability is limited to a lack of anything you wouldn't expect when going to see the movie. There are no unexpected plot twists to keep you on the edge of your seat. Nothing unusual, however, does not imply that there is nothing cool.  The whole harrier jet sequence and the visual effects in general almost justify the ticket price themselves.  All in all, the ticket price is made worthwhile by the simple escapist fantasy fun of the movie.

I loved this movie, It was a refreshing break away from all the other SciFi movies out there at the moment. I thought the acting was awesome, John Travolta & Forest Whitaker were hilarious. This has to be one of the funniest movies I've seen in a long time and as I was so entertained by this movie I've given it a 10. I can't understand why everyone how reviewed this movie so far has dumped on it so much. It's a fantasy, work of fiction it's not suppose to ressemble reality in any way, and I'm wondering if reality TV has deadened every ones senses so much that they can't detect a good entertaining load of Bull Dung if it jumped up and kicked them square in the jewels. These are probably the same people that tried to tell us Blair Witch was a master piece of filming brilliance when in fact it was the worst movie ever made. I think this movie was released before it's time, and given time will prove to be a classic SciFi in years to come.

reviews.review_title: Bad teeth and bad hair equal great movie!
reviews.content: I really wait long line to see this movie! and I can't wait to get back in long line to see it again and again! I love this movie. See it before this movie disappear from the multiplex!   Can't wait for a sequel!!!

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the book, but very good stand alone
reviews.content: This is my second review ever after just reviewing the pos Illuminate. How does Illuminate get a 7.3 on here and BFE only get a 2.5? I can no longer trust IMDB's ratings and I have been using it for years to base what movies to watch or not and now I will have to go back over every movie I have avoided now. You can NOT rate a movie compared to the book unless it just totally doesnt follow the story line, no movie can ever be as good as the book. The book has 1050 pages, to come even close to it the movie would have to be like 5hrs long or more! There are so many trash movies put out today that I think people just have no idea what a good one looks like anymore...If you gave this movie a bad rating and gave Illuminate a good one then you should be ashamed of yourself.

Trying not to let all the terrible reviews of "Battlefield Earth" influence me, I went to see the movie today in Stavanger. It was cinema number 7. 77 seats only, so it's one of the smallest in Stavanger (Norway). BE has only been shown in this cinema since it had premiere June 2. Today it was only half full and I took place on the first row where I could sit alone to enjoy the show.My first impression was the incredible lousy titles at the start. One of the great things with major sci-fi movies has been their extravagant use of great introductions with apocalyptic music to get the audience in just the right mood before impressive battleships or massive explosions are folded out on the big silver screen. In "Battlefield Earth" it looked like the title were made using the built in features of a Sony Handycam. I strived hard, but I did not manage to get in any galactic mood.I've seen a lot of bad movies that I've enjoyed. Sure they did not deserve an Oscar, but when it comes to adventure and sci-fi I'm easy to entertain. I guess that would be my reactive mind. ;) I'm still at 35 a big fan of cartoons and as most of us know there isn't a big demand for a story line if just the story telling and craftsmanship is good enough. The same goes for a movie. I treasure movies like the Star Wars and ID4 because of the entertainment value, they gave me something exciting and I willingly let down my critical guard just to be entertained. This never happened during the two hours watching BE, even though I really looked for an opening. In ID4 for example the human air fights with the aliens was rather silly, but still enjoyable to some extent. We all knew the president of America would save the world and the drunken father would give his life to save the day, but at least it had some charm. When cavemen grunted while flying jet planes in BE I was just stunned by how silly a 80 million dollar movie could be.I mean, they start off walking into this city that is supposed to have been left to erode for 1000 years, still the car wrecks looked like they were left there not more that 20 years ago. That's not cute errors, that's an insult to my intelligence when in a movie presented to be a major event. Having been spoiled with the special effects used in the previous century I can't help that I expected something better than what BE offered. Even "Brasil" had a better scenery than this so this is not a budget thing.After a while the ill-placed grunting by the humans and the put on laughter by the psychlos just became silly and you smile with them in pity. I've never liked Travolta very much as an actor but he's had a couple good roles where the directing and character has fitted his talent. Since this movie was Travolta's pet project the only excuse I can make for him is that it was probably difficult to direct him to make a good appearance in this movie.The story line was basic enough, nothing to write home about. Aliens take over the world and the small group of helpless humans that are left wins it back when they get the right leader. If this is the best Hubbard fiction book then he wasn't a very inventive writer. You know all along how it will end so what could have made it a good movie would be how surprising and inventive the makers bring you to the known ending. There are few, if any, news or surprises in BE. After "Planet of the Apes" and "ID4" I can't understand why they bothered to make BE based on this script. If you can't do it better or very differently then it's good advice to drop the whole idea. In retrospect one can only laugh when reading how people defend their decision to join the making of this tragedy after reading the script.There are many things to get annoyed over. Make-up and costumes that are just plain bad and effects that wouldn't convince anybody unless it was made before 1980. Like the double chin on the guy that ruled the psychlo colony on Earth. When you turn your head it doesn't move with the head like it was a baby's bib. They had done a lot of effort making the details look realistic because of all the close-ups, but it only worked to a certain point as long as the actors did not move a muscle.The use of echoing voices and slow motion in the action scenes was so put on it looked silly. Tons of debris falling and people running in slow motion is boring after awhile. They have not succeeded hiding the very poor cutting of the movie by adding splitting scene effects all over like it was an episode of a TV detective episode from the seventies.Can anybody explain to me why Terl let Jonnie spend time at the human library catching up on human history when he was in a hurry to mine the gold? Or how come the psychlos claims they know everything about humans but still they had no idea about what they liked to eat? Where's the logic in Jonnie learning human mathematics when pumped full of information in the psychlo learning machine, but still psychlos knew so little about humans? The rat thing and the human mathematics were just stupid and didn't have any meaning for the story. Psychlos lived in an old city with skyscrapers built by humans, but still they laughed when talked about humans operating machinery. And what about they finding the door to the vault at Fort Knox open so they could just walk straight in?A 1000 year old storehouses with military equipment is of course all intact, even the walkies and the flight simulators are full of power ready to use. Learning lots of cave men to fly jet planes in 7 days is of course no problem and in the end a whole planet is blown up with a bomb so small it can be carried by one man. Get out of here! That might almost have worked in a Marvel comic, but this movie is aiming much higher than that and that is why the result is a joke. Had Christoffer Reeve showed up in a blue suit I might have at least found the story funny.Another scene that is strange and evidence of the lack of logic in the movie happens in the cages where psychlos keep the humans. Someone shouts that one of the humans know the psychlo language and plan to fight them. Then all the humans suddenly goes ecstatic, shouting and climbing up the grates like crazy monkeys. The characters in this movie aren't even suited for a cartoon, that's how shallow and unreal they appear.Someone should count how many times the word "leverage" is used, I felt like shouting "Use the damn leverage, Jonnie!" several times. Poor Barry Pepper had the leading part but Travolta stole the show as the villain. His character was not suited to take over that role and Travolta lacked the talent to get even close to fill the misadjusted role.There might be a good twist in the rest of the story, since this is only half. I can't say. But when it comes to this movie things just didn't add up. It surely didn't do much good for the reputation of L. Ron Hubbard when his name was shown with green letters early in the end credits. If that is how he is to be remembered by the masses (assuming this might haunt us on national TV for years to come) then he does not need any critics.People started walking out after one hours but I stayed to the end. I don't agree that it was a big pain to sit through it all, but it wasn't any pleasure either. Also sat through all the end credits to see if I could spot any interesting names. Found nothing I could recognize, except that the guy responsible for the 2D effects was called Steve Fishman. ;)Do I recommend it? Yes, for people on ARS who have been following BEs release it should make a great excuse to invite some fellow critics over for some snacks and beers when it is released on video. Knowing what you will get I guarantee a fun evening, though probably not in the way intended by top Scientologist chill John Travolta.This truly is a miscarriage of a movie.Well, this is my layman opinion, as a sci-fi and movie fan.

reviews.review_title: Overlooked Work That Shows Real Genius
reviews.content: One of the truly epic science fiction films of recent memory is `Battlefield Earth.' Based on the best-selling novel by L. Ron Hubbard, the film is not only a rousing, action-packed, sci-fi adventure that evokes the best of `Star Wars,' `Independence Day,' and `Braveheart,' but also showcases the work of the much underrated director Roger Christian. This exciting tale of heroes and larger than life villains, against the backdrop of extremely cool special effects and edge of your seat action, is available as a special edition DVD, and is a must-own for anyone building their own video library.`Battlefield Earth' looks like a big-budget summer epic with money to burn and a scale worthy of `Star Wars' and its other Hollywood predecessors, but in fact the film was made with the very modest budget of $22 million (production and effects).  Director Roger Christian, who won an Academy Award for his Art Direction on the original `Star Wars,' came to the project shortly after directing the second unit on `The Phantom Menace,' and actually surprised his former boss George Lucas with his economical use of talent, production design, and special effects.  Christian's rousing and action-packed saga, which is filled with humor, adventure, and fun, takes movie-goers to a world they have never seen before-a world in which man has become an endangered species-via some innovative special effects.  While not as fluid as the computer-generated images of  `Titanic,' it is an impressive achievement that recalls the best work of `Planet of the Apes,'`Blade Runner,' and `2001: A Space Odyssey.'  Tatopolous's production design is incredibly detailed, and makes you believe that this is the war-torn world of 3000 A.D.  When you're not marveling at the eye-popping special effects or set design, you'll probably be marveling at the performance of John Travolta.  Starring as the Psychlo Security Chief Terl, Travolta firmly cements his star status both in terms of screen presence and acting chops. Forget Tony Manero from `Saturday Night Fever.'  Here, Travolta plays one of the screen's great villains, with equal parts of Shakespeare's Iago and George Lucas's Darth Vader.  Terl's underhanded interaction with Ker (Forest Whitaker) serves as a microcosm for the Psychlo's own faux-Machiavellian machinations of death, betrayal, power plays, and secret identities (with lots of faux-Machiavellian dialogue ladled on to keep the proceedings appropriately "classical"), but it's all briskly shot, edited, and paced with a contemporary sensibility. The artistry behind `Battlefield Earth' is most apparent as well, from the very first scenes through the last reel of the motion picture.  I have already mentioned the film's wonderful production design, but beyond the matte paintings and large-scale sets, there's a true artistry to how the motion picture was composed. Roger Christian creates a wonderful metaphor using the simple contrast of light and darkness in the composition of scenes.  This is especially apparent in the special edition DVD, where the light is perfectly balanced and the image superbly clear. For example, when we first meet Jonnie, the primitive protagonist, his scenes are filmed with the warmth of sunlight glinting off rugged mountains and green pastures. Later, when he allies himself with other primitives, the scenes are again in bright light, showing in a metaphorical sense how important and essential it is to band together against the hostile aliens. Even the gold in Fort Knox glows with a very warm light. Those scenes are contrasted against darker ones that show the Psychlo homeworld and the dome-city that they have made out of old Denver. The scenes are very dark, filmed with cold blue and dark green textures...you can almost feel the claustrophobia, death, and destruction in those sequences. The Psychlos are dark, dastardly aliens who have enslaved humanity and are strip-mining the planet, and what better way to portray this agenda than with the play of shadow and light. Similarly, the wipes, dissolves and transitions between scenes are handled with an artistry that I haven't seen in motion pictures in years; in fact, I can't recall the use of such dissolves unless I go all the way back to the original 1977 `Star Wars,' and the editors on that film won an Academy Award for their work. In `Battlefield Earth,' the transitions between the different scenes move the story forward like pages turning in a novel...and this artistic texture reinforces the story's literary heritage.Every once in a while a motion picture does something so extraordinary, it makes you desperate for more. You sit on the edge of your seat the entire film biting your nails while you are lost in the plot, the special effects, and the action-adventure. `Battlefield Earth' is one of those movies.  When the motion picture first debuted in theatres in May 2000, I laughed and cheered and cried and clapped, and enjoyed every moment and every aspect of the production from beginning to end.  But I was among a select few science fiction fans who got to enjoy the film in theatres.  For reasons totally unrelated to the production, critics trashed this saga of alien conquest and human rebellion during its theatrical run, and chased many fans away with their hateful and denigrating remarks.  They completely ignored or missed the film's true artistry and fun.  Now that the film is available as a special edition DVD fans can finally enjoy that artistry and fun!  They can also see for themselves what a largely misunderstood work of true genius `Battlefield Earth' really is.  I know that when I watched the special edition DVD on my home video system I experienced all of the emotions of laughing, cheering, crying, and clapping again, and enjoyed the film from beginning to end.  Experience the movie for yourself, and you'll see what I mean.

reviews.review_title: It's good if you like special effects
reviews.content: If you are a special effects fan, then  go see it. The ending was disappointing and it's not one of Travolta's best works as the bad guy unlike his portrayal of Castor Troy in Face/Off. I rate it 5/10.

I am not sure what to make of the horrendous comments coming from the `negative sector' about this movie,  but I went into the cinema having read all the reviews that completely bagged the movie,  and decided to leave my brain at the door.  Having done so,  I actually enjoyed the movie.  I did have to ignore a few plot deficiencies that others have gleefully laboured on, but on the whole I found  this entertaining.  I think that John Travolta has become my favourite actor for portraying characters on the verge of insanity.My vote is to see the movie, with an open mind left safely outside the cinema, and enjoy the movie.Entertainment rating : 7/10 Plot rating :  4/10 Acting : 7/10 Direction : 5/10 Special effects (for big screen viewing) : 7/10 Cinematic appeal : 7/10Overall score : 6/10

reviews.review_title: The worst movie of all time
reviews.content: There is a relatively simple way to measure how bad a movie is.  If you draw a graph where the x axis represents how poor in quality and entertainment value a movie is and the y axis represents how much money was spent on making such a poor movie, Battlefield Earth would have to place as the worst movie ever made.It's a hard and depressing thing to accept - that merely a century or so after the invention of film, we'd already have reached the absolute nadir of quality.  But here it is.  A movie so mindblowingly bad, so incredibly inept, so in-your-face repulsive and unpleasant that one looks back in nostalgia at the career of Ed Wood, Jr.The movie is adapted from a book by cult guru and con artist (read "Bald-faced Messiah" or check out Xenu.net for more info) L. Ron Hubbard. The book itself was pretty lousy - in terms of literary quality, it could make a serious case for being one of the worst books of the past 30 years. But it was bad more in a boring and occasionally offensive way.  Sure, it was Scientology propaganda, but its major crime was its dullness.  Over 1,000 pages of the adventures of Johnny Good Guy.  We all knew that Scientologists were buying dozens of copies from mall bookstores and then returning them to create the illusion of a sales blockbuster, but it was more amusing than disturbing.Until the movie came out.  John Travolta plunges ahead with another attempt at career suicide in yet another love letter to L. Ron.  The movie strips away the fluff from the novel, and we are left with a film reminiscent in its worst moments of a mix of "Triumph of the Will" and "Plan 9 from Outer Space".  I'm not sure this movie even had a continuity editor, nor cared to try to impose a logic on the various parts of the film.  A galaxy-spanning alien civilization relying on "man-animals" to mine gold with picks and shovels?  Aliens having to use what looked action figure cookie molds as paper?The Psychlos (stupidest name for an alien race in history) seemed to be brain damaged.  How in the world did they ever conquer their own planet, let alone the universe?  Most of the unintentional humor comes from the aliens, and especially John Travolta's performance.  It reminded me of nothing less than a megalomaniac Steve Urkel.  The laughable clawed hands and gigantic jock straps worn by the aliens are only the most noticable aspects of what can only be a huge joke played by the makeup/effects people upon the moviemakers.  I highly recommend the "Leverage" drinking game - a drink for every mention in the film of the word "leverage".The message of the film, though, was disturbing - if anything, it reminds one of Norman Spinrad's book "The Iron Dream", written as if Adolf Hitler had wrote it.  The story of a young Aryan warrior rising through society, eventually becoming a leader and inspiring those around him to superhuman feats by the mere fact of his existence is eerily similar to the film "Battlefield Earth".  Thankfully, the film was done so ineptly that it will someday become as much a cult classic as "Showgirls" or the "Rocky Horror Picture Show", but the underlying message is disturbing...

reviews.review_title: Sometimes it cuts just a little too deep...
reviews.content: Short Version : 'Professional Critics' (oxymoron?) didn't like Star Wars and Blade Runner either, remember?Extended Version : The first time I saw it, it all went straight over my head. My judgment at that time would probably be in line with all those how have voted this one so poorly.After the second viewing, in the comfort and privacy of my own home, I think my mind was far more open, feeling safe, at home. I truly was in a complete daze, dreamlike state after it was over. While I generally avoid the comic book style productions, and low budget sci-fi (trust me, this one cost Travolta's group next to nothing to produce, truly a testament to the enthusiasm of all those who must have 'volunteered' they're time), this one grabbed my attention fully, metaphors/symbols of our society interwoven carefully, and I had the sense I was style missing bits. Third viewing revealed more to me.I suspect that the vigorous slamming of this film has derived from pure base fear. A PG-13 movie, looking like big $$ but not, very accessible, presenting some brutal age old truths.I was very 'uncomfortable' with Travolta's performance on first viewing. I thought the shift from his deep Psychlo voice to the translated english voice was distracting. It wasn't until second viewing that the purpose of this became clear, the separation of these 2 races, 2 different perspectives interwoven to the point where I could easily identify with both perspectives, something that I can't remember ever experiencing before. Travolta and his team clearly knew what they wanted to produce, I would judge they're efforts as completely successful, beyond all expectations.It's a comic book movie, its metaphor, its subtle and deep and layered.Love it or hate it, you will always remember the 'warning' scene, if it makes it over 'the wall'.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a flaming bag of garbage
reviews.content: This movie is total dziedzic. I wouldn't fertilize my lawn with it. It ranks up there with the worst action movies of all time, like Swordfish....another Travolta masterpiece.

This movie took the Raspberry Awards by a storm in 2000 (I think it won 7 awards including worst director, worst film and worst actor) which speaks volumes about how good it is.When I watched it I did not know about Scientology so any criticisms I had at the time had nothing to do with its Scientology connections.SPOILER WARNINGS In the year 2000 Earth was conquered (in 9 minutes) by an evil race known as Psyclos who bare an uncanny resemblance to Klingons. Fast forward 1000 years later and Mankind is an endangered species who only survive by hiding in radiated areas where the Psyclos don't go due to a violent reaction between their breath-gas and radiation. One Human (Pepper) doesn't believe in the stories about monsters and leave home in search of a better life. He is captured by a Psyclo and then placed in the hands of Travolta. Travolta detests Earth and sees gold as his ticket back to Psyclo. He puts Pepper onto a machine which teaches him the Psyclo language, mining techniques and strangely enough how to use Psyclo weapons and teaches them about the Psyclo weaknesses. However Pepper uses his new found knowledge to start a revolt. He arms his fellow humans with ancient human weapons and all is set for the final showdown between Humanity and Psyclo.To be blunt the film was utter rubbish. There were numerous plot holes (Humanity's technology failed badly in 2000 but is more than a match for Psyclo in 3000 and the cavemen manage to learn to fly and use guns in a week and despite conquering billions of galaxies the Psyclos are really stupid and cannot shoot for fudge). The dialogue is atrocious (the script writer must have been paid for the amountof times the words ''leverage'' and ''man animal'' and ''rat brain'' were used. The Special Effects were good and the acting was okay and really are the only things that save this film from 0/10. Ridiculous plot holes and a ridiculous plot holes and ridiculous dialogue ruin this filmutterly.

i know this movie gets ripped apart by about every body, but it is well over looked. if you take it for what it is, its excellent. its a sci-fi movie, and for the genre you cant do much better. john travoltas part is superb, he plays one kick ass bad guy. just check out face off, pulp fiction, etc. i just wanted to say screw all these super critical people who think they know everything about movies, let me just say this...you don't. they are just movies meant to entertain, thats what this does.

reviews.review_title: Can I have more Dutch Angles?
reviews.content: I loved the book. I know, lots of reviewers say the book is better. That's because the reader gets to imagine the reality.But this? It barely fit the premise of the book.And really, all I'm asking for is a rewrite where EVERY scene is a Dutch Angle. Not every other, give them all to me.I mean if you are going to skew 4 out of 5, you might as well do them all.Or maybe a real edit, lock sand scape and let the actors do the work.Of course that would mean you have a good script. So maybe that doesn't work for your production.Don't bother with it, pass it up. There are better sci-fi apocalyptic flicks out there.

I think the film is greatly overrated.The film is divided into three completely different fragments - comedy, drama and disaster. The film did not turn out to be "whole" and it seems that it was made on the knee and did not reach the semantic end. It's sad, because the idea of the film is not so bad, it's just revealed, in my opinion it's bad. Quick and incomprehensible transitions from one to the other, and unfortunately, it was not possible to understand the author's thought.The film turned out to be "like everyone else" and quite primitive. The film seemed boring and meaningless to me. Yes, there were worthwhile moments in the film, but they are in the minority.My rating is 1 out of 10.

If you're a science fiction or an action/adventure fan, be sure to see `Battlefield Earth,' the film version of L. Ron Hubbard's classic science fiction novel-it's a rousing good time. The year is 3000, and the Psychlo's have conquered Earth to mine its natural resources.Even though John Travolta felt he was too old to play the young hero, Jonnie Tyler, he out-does the evil Darth Vader as Terl, the sadistic Psychlo security chief.  Hunting and caging the few man animals left, is Travolta's daily pleasure.  His make-up and his humorous sarcastic manner will make your skin crawl.  Berry Pepper is Jonnie Tyler, the scrawny human, who refuses to be Terl's obedient slave, and rallies the remaining humans in a desperate attempt to regain their freedom.  Forest Whitaker is Travolta's devious assistant Ker.  The Psychlo's seem to enjoy cheating and abusing each other almost as much as they enjoy killing the humans.
The action is non-stop.  Of course, Tyler and a small group must find the Psychlo's weaknesses, and a way to exploit them in order to win the day. No doubt `Battlefield Earth' will not please the professional critics, but what science fiction film has?  If you look up the original reviews of major sci-fi movies, such as Clark's `2001: A Space Odyssey,' you'll find the same thoughtless comments. And, many denounced `The Matrix' and `The Mummy,' as well.Have no fear, `Battlefield Earth' is fun.  It portrays the best of the human spirit, and our need to be free.  I guarantee you'll leave the theater with a smile on your face.  Whether you consider yourself a Psychlo or a rat-brain human, go see it.  You'll be glad you did.Steven Whaley, SFWA

I could see it from the first minute .. this film is going to be one of the worst films I have ever seen, I thought to my self.The story is so far from realistic as it possibly gets. People going from being almost neandertals to flying hi-tech fighterjets after a couple of hours in a flightsimulator is way too far out for me. The entire film is full of bad acting, even worse filming and stupid comments.To John Travolta: What the h... where you thinking?? What a crappy piece of work!2/10 - This movie deserves a 1, but the specialeffect made me give it one more point. NOT worth watching!

This movie has been in the bottom 100 at this page for a very long time now, and I think I can recall seeing BE conquering the 1st place! Thumps up for that! Battlefield Earth is a very very bad movie, but also very intelligent. In a strange way they have managed to create a movie, with a respected cast, an idiotic script with just as many holes as in the teeth of a sugar-addict, and still it scores over 30000 votes and more to come. This movie has won several "Worst Movie"-awards, and still people just have to see it. Sometimes things can be so awful and bad that it actually attracts someone or something. That's the case with BE. This movie has hit rock bottom, and people really want to see what a rock-bottom-movie is. Or at least that was the motivation in my case, and I don't believe I'm the only one!So a short recap, cleaver movie! It just keeps on conning people into buying and/or renting it - an everlasting circular effect, I'll definitely con people into seeing this! Just to achieve a great laugh now and then!

reviews.review_title: A modern "50's B grade sifi movie"
reviews.content: Oh please, don't make a sequel. I beg you, not a series.John Travolta is a very intelligent fellow. How could he make such a lemon?What I liked.. Special effects were interesting.What I disliked.. Everything else.The plot is implausible. The aliens conquered humans in 9 minutes when they first invaded. 1000 years later caveman comes along and kicks their butt, flying Harriers like veterans after a little simulator training.  This makes sense how? Did I mention the planes were left in the hangar for 1000 years before use? Harriers are obviously far superior to the alien craft, chewing them up and spitting out the pieces. This is why we were so easily invaded in the first place. Huh? Oh wait a minute..If I left my car in the shed for 1000 years would it still go?If you answered yes to the last question you will probably be able to enjoy the movie having thrown logic and common sense out the window.I'd rate it 1 out of 10 (for the special effects).Did I mention the alien computer sound is really really silly?...

This is a completely stupid and boring movie. 100% predictability rating! Even with your eyes closed, the horrible orchestration will tell you from second to second what happens and how to feel about it. But there is one thing that's bugging me. Those aliens: cruel, vicious, abusive.. They make me think of someone.Hey, that's it! It's us! We are them! The way they took over hour planet, steel everything and enslave everyone: It just makes me think of the news. of those estimated 50.000 child slaves in the mines in china. Or perhaps the millions of animals tortured in bio industries and research labs. Even their 'evil' totally industrialized planet looks like what we are doing to increasing portions of hour own planet. Their constant hunger for resources reminds me for instance about hour own currently heating battle for the oil under the polar ice (soon the penguins will join the 'axis of evil', mark my words).So, if we go on this way, we soon will be out there, roaming the galaxies, doing to all the unsuspecting aliens out there something very much like what is happening to us in this movie.As to what the moral teaching of this should be, i am quite stumped, i must admit. It is probably too deep. So if you think you can figure it out, this is a must see, otherwise: forget it.

reviews.review_title: A movie that makes Showgirls look good.
reviews.content: Battlefield Earth is one of the worst movies that I have ever been subjected to in my entire life.  From a script so full of plot holes that to say it has plot holes wrongly implies that there is a plot around the holes.  The acting is terrible with not a single good performance out there.  The costumes are terrible and so are the sets.  To give you an idea of how bad the concepts are, the batteries in walkie talkies still work after more than 1000 years.  There is not a single good thing that I can say about this movie other than the fact that I won't ever have to watch it again. If you are really bored, go out and watch grass grow, you will have a better time.

I have watched some very poor movies in my life, but this "movie" should probably win an award for being the worse. The camera work looks like a five-year-old hopped up on sugar filmed the "movie." The "acting," if one can call it that, was third- or forth-rate, on par with a junior high school play. I'm sitting here trying to think of something nice or positive about the movie, and the only thing that comes to mind is: "the book is worse!"Yeee ghads, what a stinker this "movie" is!

I bought the DVD when it was released. It took several viewings to really get the depth of the scenes. And they are intense.  But one can't appreciate this on one viewing.It all goes by too fast for that. It's a well done movie.

I have to admit this movie is bad but after all the comments I read here I expected it to be a lot worse. I watched this movie to have something to laugh at and make fun of but besides the plot holes that were mentioned already a hundred times it really is not as bad as everybody says.The acting was the part that surprised me most. Travolta puts in a good performance and makes the best out of what he had. The rest of the cast is at least not responsible for the bad ratings this movie received.I am anything but a fan of Scientology and wanted to dislike this movie more then anything but after having seen it I do not think it deserves the rating of only 2.3.Still, I do not recommend this movie to anyone, if you want to watch a Sci-Fi action film there are plenty of alternatives and you should really only watch this movie as a last resort.

reviews.review_title: I found it so horrible I didn't think they were serious.
reviews.content: True science fiction fans might be able to blame Battlefield Earth on the source material, as Hubbard's original "masterpiece" is often to be considered one of the most overrated pieces of literature introduced to the genre.  From cliche, two-dimensional characters to inane plotlines - it seems like a likely culprit.Unfortunately, Battlefield Earth doesn't have such an easy scapegoat. Despite some impressive production design and some clearly talented CGI artists, this film flops on nearly every measure.  The story is formulaic, predictable and generally laughable.  The dialogue, especially from the stomp happy Psychlos, seems to be written down for the Saturday morning cartoon crowd.  Travolta's attempt at being evil comes off as a bad Ming the Merciless impression, only with a costume stolen from a KISS concert and a serious need for some cough syrup.Saddest aspect of the film's pitiful performance is to watch the normally underrated Whitaker be squandered away in a feeble, simplistic role.  You seriously want to give the poor guy a hug while watching him next to Travolta's bristling overacting.Rumors of this movie being a "saga" or an "epic" are grossly off-base. The campy space comedy Ice Pirates is more fitting to the description.This movie might be better with the sound turned off, but I didn't dare to watch it a second time to find out.  The only true worth of this film is to rent the DVD and watch the commentary and behind-the-scenes footage.  The pretension at what the makers of the film believed they had before them is near high comedy, if only they weren't serious.

Wow. There really isn't much to say about this movie. It's big, it's loud, it's dumb and little things like editing, directing and acting didn't seem to be of much concern to the people that made it. There is one positive result of the movie, it kept me from ever being interested in the reading the book or becoming a Scientologist. I read somewhere that L. Ron Hubbard started Scientology as a joke, I wonder if the makers of this movie did it as a joke as well. If so then they failed because it's to bad to laugh at. All I can think about is the massive amounts of money wasted on the special effects when it should have gone towards writing a comprehensible script or better yet towards a completely different film.In conclusion this movie is gut-wrenchingly horrible!

reviews.review_title: The best movie I have ever seen.
reviews.content: This movie was a phenomenon. My friend Michael and I were hit like a broken arrow by the quality of this movie. We were expecting to grease it up with insults as our friend Martin had done, but after watching the triumphant blow out in the mad city at the end we could not help but shout, "Look who's talking!"Basically, the chemistry between Whitaker and Travolta escalates from sizzling to electric by this powerhouse duo. The two actors have no trouble in showing their characters' primary colors. Travolta pulls off Terl's arrogant swagger and slippery persona without a hitch; Whitaker convincingly reveals his thin red line of compassion towards the man-animals. The face/off between the experts is perfect!Barry Pepper is sure to reflect on this movie as the high point of his career. Like an urban cowboy, his character Ker rode unafraid into the ancient wilderness. Kept alive only by a dead mouse here and there, he lives moment by moment always thinking of the limpid eyes of an angel, his lovely wife Carlo (Kim Coates, she's so lovely), he rebels against the white man's burden, the Psychlo! Certainly not a civil action.The psychlo are obsessed with mining chains of gold from the Earth. Gold, the rarest element in the universe, is traded as vociferously among the Psychlo as it is among mankind today, so it would be an understatement to say that the Psychlo could care less about collateral damage in their mining operations.  Talk about a domestic disturbance!The ending is fantastic! I was as happy as the humans were to see the horrible poisonous enclosures destroyed. No longer would the humans be boys in the plastic bubble; they were free, free from the devil rain.WATCH THIS MOVIE! MAKE LIKE A SWORDFISH AND GET TO YOUR VIDEO STORE NOW!

Merits a viewing, if only on the basis of being surely one of the oddest films made since the 1930s. Like the (nuts yet extremely entertaining) books on which it is based, the whole thing remains close to sf space opera convention while revealing a vein of surrealism (e.g. the enormous boots the aliens wear) which seems to almost deliberately undermine the already difficult-to-swallow story. For some strange reason, massively enjoyable.

This movie is really BAD and I mean BAAAAAAAD. I'm  a SciFi geek and likes most SciFi. But this was a pure pain from start to the end. It was like walking in glue, everything goes in slow-motion. Everything with that movie sucks major. Should not been allowed to be produced in the first place.

Watched this movie after having read the book and thought it was good. Notwithstanding some criticism concerning unrealism in aspects of the movie (ie Harrier jump jets, petroleum ageing) this movie is science fiction after all. Overall a good movie

Shockingly, stunningly bad. What else is there to say that hasn't been said? Folks, the critics were right about this one. The three other people in the theater with me were laughing, but not at what Travolta WANTED us to laugh at.

reviews.review_title: Fun Grade B Sci Fi with John Travolta !
reviews.content: Personally, my hubby and I found this movie very entertaining when viewed as a grade B Sci Fi. If your a true lover of Sci Fi including grade B and can appreciate movies that are just fun Sci Fi with little meat to them, you won't be disappointed with this one. Plus if you are a Travolta fan, you will enjoy seeing him play the part of a Alien as a most entertaining new way to see him in a new light and so different from his other movies but a lot of fun! Hubby and I have always hoped that John Travolta would do another Sci Fi movie again after seeing how well he did his cruel alien character in this one. I am more then surprised it was rated so low. Travolta makes a great alien in his Klingon like get up and plays it to the hilt with grade B "gusto". In fact we thought his Klingon like costume was very acceptable. Consider how many Sci Fi movies mimic the Alien monster movies with Sigourney Weaver etc. Why should Travolta not take a good idea and make it his own. He is a terrific and scary alien in this movie.
